Description: Images missing alt text are invisible to screen readers per WCAG 1.1.1
Do: Always provide descriptive 'alt' text for meaningful images. Use empty alt="" for decorative images.
Don't: Don't use filenames like 'image1.jpg' or omit the attribute completely.

Description: Text contrast ratio below 4.5:1 makes content unreadable for low-vision users (WCAG 1.4.3)
Do: Ensure normal text has at least 4.5:1 contrast against background. Large text (18pt+) needs 3:1.
Don't: Don't rely solely on color to convey meaning or use subtle grey text on white.

Description: Interactive elements not reachable or usable via keyboard prevents access for motor-impaired users
Do: Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, links, inputs) are tab-accessible and have visible focus states.
Don't: Don't remove outline: none without replacing it with a visible focus style.

Description: Unintentional horizontal scrolling on mobile devices hurts UX
Do: Use max-width: 100% on images/containers. Use overflow-x: hidden on body if strictly necessary.
Don't: Don't set fixed widths in pixels > 320px without media queries.

Description: Touch targets too small frustrate mobile users
Do: Ensure clickable elements are at least 44x44px (iOS) or 48x48dp (Android).
Don't: Don't place tiny links close together.

Description: Form inputs without associated labels are inaccessible
Do: Use explicit <label for="id"> or implicit <label><input></label> association.
Don't: Don't use placeholder text as a replacement for labels.

Description: Using generic text inputs defines poor keyboard on mobile
Do: Use semantic input types (email, tel, number) to trigger correct mobile keyboards.

Description: Serving unoptimized/oversized images slows page load
Do: Use responsive images (srcset), WebP format, and proper sizing/compression.
Don't: Don't serve a 4000px wide image for a 300px thumbnail.

Description: Critical rendering path blocked by non-essential scripts
Do: Defer non-critical JS. Inline critical CSS. Use async/defer attributes.
Don't: Don't put large JS bundles in the <head> without async/defer.

Description: target="_blank" without rel="noopener noreferrer" exposes window object
Do: Always add rel="noopener noreferrer" to external links opening in new tabs.

Description: Skipping heading levels (h2 to h4) confuses screen readers and search engines
Do: Use a logical heading hierarchy (h1 -> h2 -> h3). One h1 per page.
Don't: Don't choose headings based on visual size alone.

Description: Lack of feedback during data fetches looks like a broken page
Do: Use skeletons or spinners to indicate loading. Avoid layout shifts.
Don't: Don't show a blank white screen while data loads.

Do: Provide specific, actionable error messages inline with the problematic field.
Don't: Don't just say 'Error occurred' or alert() errors.

Description: Overuse of <div> and <span> loses document structure meaning
Arbitrary high z-index values make maintenance a nightmare
Do: Establish a z-index scale (var(--z-modal)) or stacking contexts.

Description: Leaving console.log in production looks unprofessional and can impact performance
Don't: Don't ship debugging logs to users.
